description: The Canadian Coast Guard is looking for a provider to assist with the maintenance of buoys and their components across various regions. ...
full_summary:
Government Tender Announcement
=================================================================

### Publication Information

*   Tender Reference Number: WS3788599531
*   Solicitation Number: WS3788599531
*   Publication Date: May 17, 2023
*   Tender Closing Date: June 16, 2023, at 14:00:00

### Contract Details

*   Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   End User Entity: Canadian Coast Guard (CCG)
*   Contract Description: Maintenance Services for Buoys and Accessories in the Lower North Shore, North Shore, and Gaspésie Regions

### Scope of Work

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) seeks a contractor to provide maintenance services for buoys and their accessories in the Lower North Shore, North Shore, and Gaspésie regions. This procurement includes an Indigenous Participation Plan (IPP) to encourage bidders to maximize the participation of Indigenous businesses in this procurement.

### Key Components

*   Buoys and their accessories
*   Marine craft systems and subassemblies
*   Location and navigation systems and components
*   Paints and primers and finishes
*   Navigational equipment and instruments
*   Industrial painting services
*   Welding and brazing and soldering services

### Eligibility Criteria

All bids submitted after 14:00 EDT on June 16, 2023, will be declared non-responsive. Only bidders who have registered in the supplier database and successfully completed the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) tax setup process are eligible to bid.

### Evaluation Criteria

The selection criteria for this procurement are:

*   Technical Merit
*   Price

Bidders will be evaluated based on their compliance with the specified technical requirements, experience, expertise, and reputation in the industry.

### Tendering Process

The tendering process will be conducted through an open bidding process. Interested bidders can register in the supplier database and access the tender package by visiting:

\[Insert URL]

### Additional Information

For any queries or concerns, please contact:

Simon Presse, (TPSGC/PSPC)
Email: simon.presse@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
Phone: [Insert phone number]
Fax: [Insert fax number]

Note:

Please note that all supporting documentation and bid submissions must be received by the closing date and time to be considered responsive. The Canadian Coast Guard reserves the right to reject any bid, in whole or in part,
